page.title: 06Twyford Health Centre
page.content: There are thirty-one people that work regularly at the Health Centre:six doctors, two practice sisters, two health visitors, three district nurses,two nursing auxiliaries,one physiotherapist, one allergist, one chiropodist, one dietician, eleven receptionists and secretaries and one cleaner. On average, the doctors see about one hundred patients a week.On a quiet day they may see fourteen patients and on a busy day fourty-five.On average they work 66 hours a week, 4l hours in the Health Centre and 25 hours on call. The most common type of illness they meet is viral upper respiratory tract infection.This includes all the common colds, sore throats and croaky voices. The piece of equipment that the doctors use the most is their stethoscope.
